mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Built as a refectory, it brought mass dining to the Grounds. In 1958, repurposed as registrar’s and bursar’s office, and named Garrett Hall. Later the office of the Dean of the College of Arts and Sciences; became the Batten School, 2009. — Wilson/Neuman/Butler, The University of Virginia Campus Guide, 2012. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: James Murray Howard University of Virginia Historic Buildings and Grounds Collection
